alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 5:19PM MST until August 12 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 517 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain had ended in south central Yavapai County over the Castle Creek and Hassayampa River basins south of Wagoner and just north of Castle Hot Springs. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Hot Springs and Lake Pleasant. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... East Fork Castle Creek, Spring Creek, Bitter Creek, Dead Mexican Creek, Buckhorn Creek, Ash Creek, Buzzard Roost Creek, Hamlin Wash, Black Butte Wash, Tiger Creek, Sand Creek, Minnehaha Creek, Little Buckhorn Creek, Humbug Creek, Cherry Creek, Whipsaw Creek, Amazon Gulch, Tussock Spring Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Castle Creek, Agua Fria River, Hassayampa River, Banty Creek, Slim Jim Creek, Oak Creek and French Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
